hackathon-description-text: You’ve heard of hack-a-thons: people gathered to create tech that tackles a specific problem, from feeding the hungry to helping travelers to making people laugh.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Clinical Assistant Professor of Communication and Media Management at Fordham University’s Gabelli School of Business

hackathon-eligibility: Anyone in the New York City area over the age of 18 can attend and participate!
hackathon-requirements: Bring your own devices and resources to the event: cameras, laptops, microphones, cables, props, etc. Final created media must be consumable within 2 minutes.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Lunch w/David Kaufman, Travel Editor, NYPost
Free Media Books from O'Reilly Media
Free Pass to New Work City
Free Pass to the Next MediaThon

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Fordham University Lincoln Center Campus, 155 West 60th Street, New York, NY 10023, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Project stuck to the topic, met 2-min criteria.
Appeals to a broad community of metropolitan/cosmopolitan Americans or global citizens
Clarity of Message - as a consumer, you understand it, get what they're saying
Easily sharable through social media and potentially viral.
Did they meet the objectives that they defined for the project as a group.
Allowable on Youtube, up to light "R" rating
Does this have several components, intricate parts, profundity, provocativeness, etc.
Did it make you smile or laugh?

hackathon-location-address: Fordham University Lincoln Center Campus, 155 West 60th Street, New York, NY 10023, USA
hackathon-description-header: Join us May 31 to help create media — video, text, social media, APIs,  guidebooks and more — about active vacations: mountain climbing, disaster relief, whatever gets you excited about travel!
